intro: Swertia tetrapetala var. yezo-alpina, commonly known as Yezo alpine swertia, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers during the summer months, which are typically arranged in racemose inflorescences. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for studies on alpine flora and ecological adaptation.
